meanings.definition: To assign or credit to a particular cause or source.
meanings.sent1: She reattributes her success to hard work and determination.
meanings.sent2: The detective reattributes the crime to the notorious gang in town.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly reattributes his messy room to the 'invisible cleaning fairy'.
meanings.sent4: The artist reattributes the beauty of the painting to his muse's inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reattributes the students' progress to their dedication and effort.

meanings.definition: To transfer or assign a quality or characteristic to someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The author reattributes bravery to the main character in her novel.
meanings.sent2: The chef reattributes the delicious taste of the dish to the secret ingredient.
meanings.sent3: He playfully reattributes his clumsiness to wearing mismatched socks.
meanings.sent4: The coach reattributes the team's unity to their shared goal of winning the championship.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reattributes the discovery to years of meticulous research and experimentation.
